text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Savannah, Georgia | settlement_type = City | population_as_of = 2020 | population_total = 147780 | image_flag = Flag of Savannah, Georgia.svg | image_seal = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_type1 = State | subdivision_type2 = County | subdivision_name = United States | subdivision_name1 = Georgia | subdivision_name2 = Chatham | government_footnotes = | government_type = | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = Van R. Johnson (D) }} Savannah is a city in the U.S. state of Georgia. It is Georgia's 5th most populous city, and has a population of 147,780 as of 2020. This city is also the oldest city in Georgia being established in 1733. == History == Savannah was founded in 1733 by a group of settlers, led by James Oglethorpe. == Geography == Savannah is located near the Savannah River, 20 miles upstream from the Atlantic Ocean. It has a land area of about 108.7 square miles. == References == Category:County seats in Georgia
title: Savannah, Georgia
